greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of steps to reach a cycle in Collatz problem.
comment: a(1)=a(2)=a(4)=0 as A006370(A006370(A006370(x)))=x for x=1,2,4 [corrected by _Rémy Sigrist_, Jun 28 2020];
a(n) = A006577(n) - 2 for n > 2 (if the conjecture holds).
For n>2: let L = a(n) mod 3, then A006460(n) = if L=0 then 4 else L. - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Nov 17 2013
link: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
Index entries for sequences related to 3x+1 (or Collatz) problem
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Collatz Problem
program: f k x = if x `elem` [1,2,4] then k else f (k + 1) (a006370 x)
xref: Essentially the same sequence as A112695.
results.author: _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Apr 18 2008
